ygData.subject: Re: Fetch process
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, Thanks for help! I ll try to use the uriUniq.log file. Artem. ... you look at live reports you can see the URLs you want. Also, you can enable

Thanks for help! I'll try to use the uriUniq.log file.  
  
Artem.=
  
  
--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, M C <manavx81@...> wrote:  
>=
  
> Hi,  
>   
> Surprising, I would think crawl.log would give that becau=
se when  
you look at 'live' reports you can see the URLs you want. Also, y=
ou  
can enable uriUniq.log on heritrix.properties file, this gives all  
U=
ri's presented to the filter.  
>   
> Manav  
>   
> Artem Antonov <antono=
v.artem@...> wrote:                                   
Hello,   
>     
>  =
Yes, you are right. In the regular expression one slash has to  
be.   
>  =
Thanks.   
>     
>  The question is where in 'order.xml' file (in which ta=
g section)  
I   
>  should place this regular expression to get in 'crawl.=
log' URIs  
with   
>  only these extensions (*.doc, *.ppt).   
>     
>  T=
hanks,   
>     
>  Artem.   
>     
>  --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.=
com, M C <manavx81@> wrote:   
>  >   
>  > Hi,   
>  >    
>  > Not quite =
sure on your question, but I would check the regular   
>  expression,   
>=
  > .*(?i)\.(doc|ppt)$, not sure why you have two slashes.   
>  >    
>  >=
 Let me know if this helps.   
>  >    
>  > Manav   
>  >    
>  > Artem A=
ntonov <antonov.artem@> wrote:                                    
>  Hi,  =
   
>  >       
>  >  Thanks a lot for help.     
>  >  I've added ContentT=
ypeRegExFilter to the 'midfetch-filter' and     
>  >  'write-processors' s=
ections, and now only html/text contents  
are     
>  >  saved into the AR=
C file.     
>  >       
>  >  The one problem I couldn't solve is to accep=
t only URIs that  
end     
>  >  with the specified pattern (for example, =
".doc, *.ppt").     
>  >       
>  >  I use 'org.archive.crawler.deciderul=
es.DecidingScope' in Crawl   
>  Scope     
>  >  to determine whether a UR=
I is accepted or rejected. So, in   
>  'scope'     
>  >  section I've add=
ed:     
>  >       
>  >  <newObject name=3D"filePattern"     
>  >    
> =
  
class=3D"org.archive.crawler.deciderules.MatchesFilePatternDecideRule"> =
    
>  >     <string name=3D"decision">ACCEPT</string>     
>  >     <stri=
ng name=3D"use-preset-pattern">Custom</string>     
>  >     <string name=
=3D"regexp">.*(?i)(\\.(doc|ppt))$</string>     
>  >  </newObject>     
>  =
>       
>  >  But in 'crawl.log' file are saved all URIs from fetched   
>=
  documents.     
>  >  How to extract only URIs that match the regexp?    =
 
>  >       
>  >  Thanks.     
>  >       
>  >  Regards,     
>  >  Arte=
m.     
>  >       
>  >       
>  >       
>  >       
>  >       
>  >  -=

ote:

respons=
e

ch the body or

 <antonov.artem@> wrote:

 >  > >

 > > How I can set the regular expression to specify which file

>  >  to

y "txt" and "html" files)?

 questions are:

>  >  > > 1) In which sect=
ion I should define a RegExp:             
>  >  > > - tab "Submodules" in =
Web console ->  
"pre-fetch-processors"     
>  >  section     
>  >  >    =
         
>  >  > > -> Preselector -> <myFilter>, OR             
>  >  > >=
 - tab "Submodules" in Web console -> "fetch-processors"   
>  section     =

>  >  ->      
>  >  >            
>  >  > > HTML -> <myFilter> ?         =
    
>  >  > >              
>  >  > > 2) All of types org.archive.crawler.=
filter.* are  
Deprecated,   
>  so     
>  >  I       
>  >  >           
=

>  t=
ype,     
>  >  and     
>  >  >             
>  >  > > define my decide-ru=
les (for example,

tchesRegExpDecideRule)?

 section in order.xml file:

>  >  > > <newOb=
ject name=3D"Preselector"

refetch.Preselector">

boolean>

/map>

>

 > >  <string name=3D"block-by-regexp"></string>          
>  >  > >  <stri=
ng name=3D"allow-by-regexp"></string>

<string name=3D"allow-by-regexp"></string>

 >  > > Can I define here a RegExp to restrict files types to  
fetch?     =
